results.title: Betty Blue = 37.2 Le Matin
results.creator_credit: Claudie Ossard, Jean-Jacques Beineix, Constellation and Cargo Films
results.brief_description: A contemporary tale of ‘amour fou’ based on the novel by Phillipe Djian, “Betty blue” is the story of Zorg (Jean-Hugues Anglade) who at 31 has accepted a certain measure of resignation, and the beautiful, passionate nineteen year old Betty (Beatrice Dalle), who dramatically enters his life and proceeds to dismantle his complacency with her volatile, urgent nature. Betty and Zorg’s life together is dominated by Betty’s fearless embracing of whatever emotion or new circumstance presents itself. This propels them both into a series of events and encounters by turns comic and poignant. Betty’s restlessness and her ever-worsening mental illness finds a focus in Zorg. She decides he is a brilliant writer and she sets about despatching his diaries to potential publishers. In the face of disappointment, however, Betty’s increasingly extreme reactions begin to reveal an instinct for self-destruction that Zorg is helpless to subdue. French language with English subtitles.

results.title: Better work methods. Pt. 5
results.brief_description: Illustrates original and then improved methods for (i) opening shipping cartons for breakfast cereal; (ii) trimming asparagus; (iii) folding packing papers; (iv) arranging height of work benches; (v) arranging seating accommodation for operatives. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: Better Wine Enjoyment
results.brief_description: Better Wine Enjoyment By the Experts, takes the viewer to Australia’s most famous vineyards, as well as some of the smaller wineries, seeking out the secrets of good wine from the winemakers themselves. Presented by Collin Segelov, it starts with the history of winemaking in Australia and then moves to the art of growing the fruit and making the wine. Once in a bottle, it proceeds to teach the viewer how to taste, choose, drink and

results.title: Better weather forecasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
The Australian Numerical Meteorological Research Centre uses high powered computers, mathematical models and information from the Bureau of Meteorology in their attempts to improve weather forecasting.

results.title: Better ways. Part 1. Introducing work study
results.creator_credit: World Wide, British Productivity Council, James Carr and Clifford Parris
results.brief_description: A survey of work study showing how it arises in response to the need to improve methods of work and how its “questioning technique”, carried out in full cooperation with all concerned - workers and maanagement alike - enables it to develop the improvements needed.

results.title: Better ways. 4. One man and his job
results.creator_credit: British Productivity Council, Denis Ward and Peter Morley
results.brief_description: Shows application of Work Study methods. The main example is the assembly of governor elements for diesel fuel injection pumps. Reveals how a job is analysed on a two-handed chart. The film digresses to demonstrate the principles of Motion Economy shown under laboratory conditions at the Work Study School of the College of Aeronautics. The film shows how special fixtures and bench designs were fashioned, and the worker trained in the new methods. Stresses that the human factor must always be understood in Work Study.
